documentation.

## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install rlm in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure rlm package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to rlm
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/LA3D/rlm):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/LA3D/rlm.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/LA3D/rlm)

``` sh
$ conda install -c LA3D rlm
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/rlm/)

``` sh
$ pip install rlm
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/LA3D/rlm)’s
[pages](https://LA3D.github.io/rlm/). Additionally you can find package
manager specific guidelines on [conda](https://anaconda.org/LA3D/rlm)
and [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/rlm/) respectively.
